meanings.definition: An enzyme that is responsible for the formation of prostaglandins.
meanings.sent1: The cyclooxygenase helps make prostaglandins in the body.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study cyclooxygenase to understand how prostaglandins are produced.
meanings.sent3: The cyclooxygenase enzyme decided to throw a prostaglandin party in the cell.
meanings.sent4: Prostglandins are like messages sent by the cyclooxygenase courier.
meanings.sent5: Imagine the cyclooxygenase as a tiny factory churning out prostaglandins.

meanings.definition: A protein that plays a key role in the inflammatory response.
meanings.sent1: When there's inflammation, the cyclooxygenase protein gets to work.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are researching how to regulate the cyclooxygenase in inflammation.
meanings.sent3: The cyclooxygenase protein threw a party, but it got a bit too inflamed.
meanings.sent4: Inflammation is like a fire alarm triggered by the cyclooxygenase protein.
meanings.sent5: The cyclooxygenase protein is the firefighter of the body's inflammatory response.

meanings.definition: A target for nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs.
meanings.sent1: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs aim to block the cyclooxygenase.
meanings.sent2: Patients take medication to reduce the activity of cyclooxygenase.
meanings.sent3: The cyclooxygenase was not happy about being the target of so many drugs.
meanings.sent4: Blocking the cyclooxygenase is like putting a lock on the inflammation door.
meanings.sent5: The cyclooxygenase is the bullseye for nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs.
